page.title: 02ARBROATH ABBEY
page.content: This famous abbey was founded by King William,the Lion in the 12th century for the monks of Tiron. Long before the abbey was completed, King William died and his body was buried in front of the high alter.It grew to become the second richest abbey in Scotland. However, Scotland at this time was frequently attacked by the English and so the nobles wrote a letter to the Pope,in Latin,asking for their independence. The letter was composed by Bernard de Linton and when it was finished,the noblemen came from all over Scotland to sign it and add their seal. The reformation changed everything.The monks moved away and the abbey soon fell into ruin. Much of the stone of the abbey was used by the people of Arbroath for building their homes.
